For many reasons 
These "Tube Transport" systems relied more on rails

For example 
It is cheaper to transport one or two tubes by train rather than by car

Most of the arrack manufacturing spots were near railway stations 

Many would be surprised to know that the guys would hoist these arrack filled tubes over the shoulder and get into passenger trains and then alight at the stop just before the main station

In those days, With relatively less cars "Mass Casuality" usually meant spurious arrack and methanol poisoning causing blindness and death 
These days, Mass Casualty is mostly Road Traffic Accident and rarely other cause

Tamil Nadu and England have almost similar populations 

1.5 lakh people work in TN Govt Health Department
14 Lakhs people work in NHS 

almost 10 times 
Read it again - almost 10 time 

Now 
That is because tax is more in UK

For Example 

If you can pay only 5% GST, then Govt can give Primary Care and School Education Free

If you want College Education and Secondary Care also free, you need to pay 10% GST 

This is just an example 
Don't start an argument on specifics

First 
We need to decide 

"I need these services from Govt and for which I am ready to pay this much Tax"

If you pay more Tax, then you get more services from Govt and hence more govt jobs

If you pay less tax, then less services from govt and hence less govt jobs https://t.co/A3hbTxDFEB

And 
Every one is forced to Pay tax for the Digital Transaction 

In other words
The Ratio of 
"White" (Taxed)  : "Black" (Untaxed) 
money a hero gets is influenced by the number of tickets sold online + via Credit cards : Number  Tickets sold for Cash at Counters

But 
Once Tickets were sold online
it is more of Digital Transaction and less of direct box office sales

So 
The Money flow from 
Viewer to Theatre to Distributor to Producer to Actor now goes by two routes
1. Paper Cash 
2. Digital

Digital Transactions very well reduce the  "Money for which Tax Not Paid" and get more income to Govt 

Example Cinema : When Tickets were sold in Counters --> Paper Cash Collected --> Cash to Distributors --> Cash to Producers --> Paper Cash to Actors and Technicians

Does Digital Transactions Eradicate Corruption
No 

But 
Does Digital Transactions Increase Tax Compliance 
Yes 

#Thread

First and Foremost 
We need to differentiate between a "Money earned through Corruption" and "Money for which Tax Not Paid"
